Gabriel Rivera: Game Designer

Hi! My name is Gabriel Rivera, I am a 3rd year student Game Designer currently enrolled at University of California: Santa Cruz.

Find Out More

Goals

Currently, lots of work have been centered around character, story, encounter, and systemic design. I aim to become a better game designer and broaden as well as strengthen my skills throughout my time in college as well as further beyond.

Get Started!

Resume

Resume link
Interactive Game
Escape the Lab

A Sci-Fi interactive story game made using twine. This game comes with two major branching paths and nine distinct endings. How will you survive this the chaotic world you find yourself in?

Adventure Campaign
Casa de la Marina
An adventure campaign designed for the ttrpg game: Kids on Bikes. This adventure takes place in a larger supernatural mystery town based on Santa Cruz.
Interactive Story
Are you alone?
A horror interactive story game using custom code that I have adapted from my professor. The game has multiple unique endings depening on what the user does and does not do.
Card Game
Cat Card Game
An in development card game based on the book series "Warrior Cats". A 1v1 card game in which the goal of the game is to win 3 short battles by reducing the enemy resources to 0.
Design Exercise
Finalize Me: Queer Stories
A character design exercise using twine. In this game, you're able to ask queer characters about themselves before finalize their appearance yourself. Meant for queer people and character designers.
Many more to come!
